result.execSummary:
The defendant Heath L Mrotek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Heath L Mrotek in court, in custody with attorney Alec Nocco.  Kurt B. Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given. Revocation packet was reviewed by the parties.  No factual errors. Nothing from the victim.  Agreement reached.

Court orders
90 days jail w/huber 
Any unpaid  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court to become civil judgment
85 days sentence credit
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 23, 2018 at 02:00 pm.
Statement of negotiated plea.

Defendant Heath L Mrotek in court with attorney Andrew W. Boden.  Kurt B. Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Deft enters a plea of guilty to count 1, Count 2 is DRI.   Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.  Court takes a break.  Back on the record at 11:11 am.  

Court orders:
12 months probation w/held sentence
no contact w/PD unless agent and victim agree
mental health eval if recommended by the agent
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
DNA sample unless already done.
one day sentence credit if revoked
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 8, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Heath L Mrotek in court with attorney Andrew W. Boden.  Kurt B. Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called appearances given.  Dr. Benson is also present at the hearing.  Court to determine if deft is competent to proceed.  Defense is going to stipulate to the deft being competent to proceed.  Court questions the deft.  Court rules that the deft is competent to proceed with this case.  Court schedules the plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant, Heath L Mrotek appeared. ADA Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called. Zengler provides status to court. Def indicates that he has sought counsel. Court calls Public Defender's office. Public defender's office has not found an attorney as of today's date. An attorney will not be available for next weeks trial. State does not object to an adjournment. Victim has not responded to calls by DA's office. Court adjourns trial to allow def to find attorney. Scheduling conference will be set for  June 22, 2017 at 8:00 a.m. Pubs office notified.
Status conference on June 2, 2017 at 10:15 am.

Defendant, Heath L Mrotek appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Court addresses the party and says that he just contacted the public defender office.  Not ready to proceed to trial.  Court calls the public defenders office.  Court and State does not have a problem with an adjournment if an attorney is found but cannot make the jury trial date.

Defendant Heath L Mrotek in court with attorney John M Bliss.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called apperances given.  Defense informs the court that the deft does not want to proceed.  Defense attorney informs the court that he wishes to withdraw.  Court grants the withdrawal of the attorney.  Court advises the deft as to his rights of an attorney.  Deft states that he understands his rights.  Defense attorney advises the court that he will let the Public Defenders office know of the withdrawal and send the paperwork over to the office.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2017 at 08:00 am.
